content: Cu­(NO3)2·3H2O (10 mg, 0.041 mmol) and H3CPAH (11 mg, 0.036 mmol) were mixed with 2 mL of dimethylformamide (DMF), 1.2 mL of H2O, and 0.15 mL of HBF4 at room temperature. The solution was transferred to a 20 mL vial and heated to and held at 80 °C for 24 h, followed by natural cooling to room temperature. Green crystals of Cu–CPAH were yielded and collected through filtration, rinsed with ethanol, and dried in cold air. Yield: 57% (on the basis of H3CPAH). Analysis calculated (%): C, 44.30; H, 3.75; N, 10.15. Found (%): C, 44.28; H, 3.77; N, 10.15. IR (KBr, cm–1): 3394 (m), 3137 (s), 1888 (m), 1633 (s), 1405 (s), 1109 (m), 936 (s), 874 (w), 839 (m), 791 (s), 769 (w), 739 (s), 581 (s), 533 (s), 447 (s).
clean_text:
Experimental Section

Synthesis of Cu-CPAH

Cu(NO3)2⋅3H2O (10 mg, 0.041 mmol) and H3CPAH (11 mg, 0.036 mmol) were mixed with 2 mL of dimethylformamide (DMF), 1.2 mL of H2O, and 0.15 mL of HBF4 at room temperature. The solution was transferred to a 20 mL vial and heated to and held at 80 °C for 24 h, followed by natural cooling to room temperature. Green crystals of Cu-CPAH were yielded and collected through filtration, rinsed with ethanol, and dried in cold air. Yield: 57% (on the basis of H3CPAH). Analysis calculated (%): C, 44.30; H, 3.75; N, 10.15. Found (%): C, 44.28; H, 3.77; N, 10.15. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3394 (m), 3137 (s), 1888 (m), 1633 (s), 1405 (s), 1109 (m), 936 (s), 874 (w), 839 (m), 791 (s), 769 (w), 739 (s), 581 (s), 533 (s), 447 (s).
